page.title: 08Red House Stud, Exning
page.content: Red House Stud was built between the two wars by Lord Glanely. When he died it returned to arable land and only restored to a working stud in 1970, by the present management. The stud includes 120 acres of grass-land and paddocks, mainly used by the mares, foals, and the cows that are needed to eliminate the red worm in the grass that the horses eat. The stallion at stud is called{"Mansing"}and usually covers 52 mares a year. He is 16 years old and worth over two million pounds, and each visiting mare is charged Â£2,500 to be covered by him. They have 40 to 50 foals born a year between January and June and these are sold throughout the world. New technology, for example the introduction of Test tube foals is creeping into the racing industry to enable more and healthier foals to be born.
